intro: Dilivaria ebracteata, commonly known as the slender lily, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has strap-like leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies, though it is not widely cultivated.
